intro: Terniola diversifolia, commonly known as the diverse-leaved terniola, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that vary in shape and size, giving it its common name. Its small, white flowers are typically clustered in inflorescences, and it produces small, smooth fruits. Terniola diversifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands.
